verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
If we assay <S%H5254><s%> to commune <S%H1697><s%> with you, will you be grieved? <S%H3811><s%> but who <S%H4310><s%> can <S%H3201><s%> withhold <S%H6113><s%> himself from speaking? <S%H4405><s%>
Behold, <S%H2009><s%> you have instructed <S%H3256><s%> many, <S%H7227><s%> and you have strengthened <S%H2388><s%> the weak <S%H7504><s%> hands. <S%H3027><s%>
Your words <S%H4405><s%> have upheld <S%H6965><s%> him that was falling, <S%H3782><s%> and you have strengthened <S%H553><s%> the feeble <S%H3766><s%> knees. <S%H1290><s%>
But now <S%H6258><s%> it is come <S%H935><s%> on you, and you faint; <S%H3811><s%> it touches <S%H5060><s%> you, and you are troubled. <S%H926><s%>
Is not this your fear, <S%H3374><s%> your confidence, <S%H3690><s%> your hope, <S%H8615><s%> and the uprightness <S%H8537><s%> of your ways? <S%H1870><s%>

Remember, <S%H2142><s%> I pray <S%H4994><s%> you, who <S%H4310><s%> ever perished, <S%H6><s%> being innocent? <S%H5355><s%> or where <S%H375><s%> were the righteous <S%H6662><s%> cut <S%H3582><s%> off?
Even as I have seen, <S%H7200><s%> they that plow <S%H2790><s%> iniquity, <S%H205><s%> and sow <S%H2232><s%> wickedness, <S%H5999><s%> reap <S%H7114><s%> the same.
By the blast <S%H5397><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> they perish, <S%H6><s%> and by the breath <S%H7307><s%> of his nostrils <S%H639><s%> are they consumed. <S%H3615><s%>

The roaring <S%H7581><s%> of the lion, <S%H738><s%> and the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the fierce <S%H7826><s%> lion, <S%H7826><s%> and the teeth <S%H8127><s%> of the young <S%H3715><s%> lions, <S%H3715><s%> are broken. <S%H5421><s%>
The old lion <S%H3918><s%> perishes <S%H6><s%> for lack <S%H1097><s%> of prey, <S%H2964><s%> and the stout lion's <S%H3833><s%> whelps <S%H1121><s%> are scattered <S%H6504><s%> abroad. <S%H6504><s%>
Now a thing <S%H1697><s%> was secretly <S%H1589><s%> brought <S%H1589><s%> to me, and my ear <S%H241><s%> received <S%H3947><s%> a little <S%H8102><s%> thereof.
In thoughts <S%H5587><s%> from the visions <S%H2384><s%> of the night, <S%H3915><s%> when deep <S%H8639><s%> sleep <S%H8639><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> men, <S%H582><s%>
Fear <S%H6343><s%> came <S%H7122><s%> on me, and trembling, <S%H7460><s%> which made all <S%H7230><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> to shake. <S%H6342><s%>
Then a spirit <S%H7307><s%> passed <S%H2498><s%> before <S%H5921><s%> my face; <S%H6440><s%> the hair <S%H8185><s%> of my flesh <S%H1320><s%> stood <S%H5568><s%> up:

It stood <S%H5975><s%> still, but I could not discern <S%H5234><s%> the form <S%H4758><s%> thereof: an image <S%H8544><s%> was before <S%H5048><s%> my eyes, <S%H5869><s%> there was silence, <S%H1827><s%> and I heard <S%H8085><s%> a voice, <S%H6963><s%> saying,
Shall mortal <S%H582><s%> man <S%H582><s%> be more just <S%H6663><s%> than God? <S%H433><s%> shall a man <S%H1400><s%> be more pure <S%H2891><s%> than his maker? <S%H6213><s%>
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> he put no <S%H3808><s%> trust <S%H539><s%> in his servants; <S%H5650><s%> and his angels <S%H4397><s%> he charged <S%H7760><s%> with folly: <S%H8417><s%>

How <S%H637><s%> much <S%H637><s%> less in them that dwell <S%H7931><s%> in houses <S%H1004><s%> of clay, <S%H2563><s%> whose <S%H834><s%> foundation <S%H3247><s%> is in the dust, <S%H6083><s%> which are crushed <S%H1792><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the moth? <S%H6211><s%>
They are destroyed <S%H3807><s%> from morning <S%H1242><s%> to evening: <S%H6153><s%> they perish <S%H6><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%> without any regarding <S%H7760><s%> it.
Does not their excellency <S%H3499><s%> which is in them go <S%H5265><s%> away? <S%H5265><s%> they die, <S%H4191><s%> even without <S%H3808><s%> wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>
